main.java.GUINew

Class RotorPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • main.java.GUINew.RotorPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.Observer, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class RotorPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.util.Observer
    Top panel of the modular GUI for the Enigma Machine. Allows setting of all Enigma settings, and helps propagate those settings to other classes that need them through the use of the Enigma Singleton.
    Version:
    0.9 Dec 9, 2013
    Author:
    Team Enigma
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  RotorPanel.ButtonListener
      Private ActionListener that handles the events for the GUI components that handle the plugboard settings.
      private class  RotorPanel.EnigmaSpinner
      Probably unnecessary inner class that gives us an easy way to identify different JSpinner objects.
      private class  RotorPanel.PositionsListener
      Private ActionListener class that handles the events for the GUI components that represent the rotor positions of the Enigma machine.
      private class  RotorPanel.RingSettingsListener
      Private ActionListener class that handles the events for the GUI components that represent the ring settings of the rotors.
      private class  RotorPanel.RotorListener
      Private ActionListener class that handles the events for the GUI components that represent the rotor choices of the machine.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RotorPanel

        public RotorPanel()
        Constructor, initializes all relevant parts. Calls private build methods and glues them together.

    • Method Detail

      • buildTopPanel

        private javax.swing.JPanel buildTopPanel()
        Builds top half of the RotorPanel. This half contains all the components to allow setting the EnigmaMachine settings.
        Returns:
        the top panel.

      • buildPlugboardPanel

        private javax.swing.JPanel buildPlugboardPanel()
        Builds the plugboard panel, responsible for displaying the current plugboard state, and initializing the pop-up window that will allow users to set the plugboard.
        Returns:
        the plugboard panel.

      • printState

        private void printState()

      • setRotorPositions

        private void setRotorPositions(char[] positions)
        Helper method that sets the rotor positions of the GUI components. The GUI components' ActionListeners then propagate those changes to the singleton instance of the EnigmaMachine.
        Parameters:
        positions - the new positions of the rotors.

      • setPlugboard

        private void setPlugboard(java.lang.String pbmap)
        Helper method that sets the string that is representative of the plugboard settings. Updates the text field and sets the plugboard settings in the EnigmaSingleton.
        Parameters:
        pbmap - the new plugboard string

      • setRotorChoices

        private void setRotorChoices(int[] rotors)
        Helper method that sets the state of the GUI components that represent the rotor choices. These changes then propagate down to the EnigmaSingleton through the ActionListeners of the components.
        Parameters:
        rotors - the new rotor selection.

      • setRingSettings

        private void setRingSettings(char[] ringSettings)
        Helper method that sets the state of all the GUI components that represent the ring settings of the rotors. These changes then propagate down to the EnigmaSingleton through the components' ActionListeners.
        Parameters:
        ringSettings -

      • setReflector

        private void setReflector(int reflectorNum)
        Helper method that sets the state of the GUI component that represents the reflector choice. These changes then propagate down to the EnigmaSingleton through the components' ActionListeners.
        Parameters:
        reflectorNum -

      • rotorCheckOn

        private void rotorCheckOn()

      • rotorCheckOff

        private void rotorCheckOff()

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable arg0,
          java.lang.Object arg1)
        Implements the Observer functionality. When the method is called by the Observable (EnigmaSingleton), it triggers the panel to update its local machine state and all relevant GUI components.
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer
